section.title: Public Beta available!
section.p: As of May 29, the first public release of the Sámi proofing tools is available. This is an historic event in the Sámi computing age, and marks an important milestone in keeping Sámi alive in the modern society. Go directly to our download page, or read more about the release in the release notes, or download here:

section.title: What is Divvun?
section.p: Divvun is a project run by the Sámi Parliament in order to make spell checkers for the Sámi languages. In the first phase of the project this means spell checkers and hyphenation for Northern Sámi, and spell checkers for Lule Sámi - the background for this prioritising is found on this page. The tools will work on Windows, Linux and Mac, with the usual office environment programs.

section.title: Finished products
section.p: When the project is closing at the end of 2007, the final proofing tools will be available free of charge by downloading from the project home page. The downloads are traditional installers that install the the proofing tools easily on the users' computers. The proofing tools work the same way as proofing tools for other languages. The Norwegian Sámi Parliament and the University of Tromsø retain the rights to most of the produced software, together with the copyright holders of whatever is included. All interested parties can both use the software and download the source code free of charge (only our source code).

section.title: Anonymous cvs
section.p: The source code to this project is open source, and it is available through anonymous cvs. We have also written a document on how to find your way through the source code.

section.title: Download documentation
section.p: All the documentation on this project is available on this site. If you would like to have this documentation on your own computer, follow the instruction on anonymous cvs, then go on to setup forrest. After that all our documentation sits on your own computer, and you can navigate through it with a web browser.
